DOC.criteria: 1 . Patients diagnose nonvalvular Atrial Fibrillation ( AF ) atrial flutter ( documented 12lead electrocardiogram ( ECG ) Holter record ) eligible oral anticoagulant ( OAC ) therapy 2 . Presence least one follow risk factor stroke : Prior stroke transient ischaemic attack ( TIA ) Age ≥75 year Hypertension Diabetes mellitus Symptomatic heart failure [ New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) Class ≥II ] 3 . Must able selfadminister treatment 4 . Either Vitamin K antagonist ( VKA ) treat VKA naive . Patients treat VKA receive VKA treatment ≥3 month . VKA naïve patient receive VKA treatment 30 day within last 12 month . Patients describe either criterion eligible study 5 . Patients previously treat acetylsalicylic acid ( ASA ) stroke prevention allow ( switch Apixaban ) 6 . Patients screen minimental state examination ( MMSE ) 24 7 . Subject Reenrollment : This study permit reenrollment subject discontinue study pretreatment failure Age Reproductive Status : ) Men woman ≥18 year age ii ) Women childbearing potential ( WOCBP ) must use method ( ) contraception base table protocol . WOCBP must negative serum urine pregnancy test ( minimum sensitivity 25 IU/L equivalent unit HCG ) within 24 hour prior start study medication iv ) Women must breastfeed v ) Men sexually active woman childbearing potential ( WOCBP ) must use contraceptive method failure rate le 1 % per year vi ) Women childbearing potential ( ie , postmenopausal surgically sterile ) ; azoospermic men require contraception 1 . Target Disease Exceptions : 1 . Atrial fibrillation flutter due reversible cause ( e.g . thyrotoxicosis , pericarditis ) 2 . Clinically significant ( moderate severe ) mitral stenosis 3 . Cardiac valvular disease require surgery 4 . Planned major surgery or/and invasive procedure and/or atrial fibrillation flutter , ablation procedure and/or cardioversion 5 . Patients receive Rivaroxaban , Dabigatran Apixaban 2 . Medical History Concurrent Diseases : 1 . Conditions atrial fibrillation require chronic anticoagulation ( e.g. , prosthetic mechanical heart valve , venous thromboembolism ; also see Section 3.4 , Concomitant Treatments ) 2 .
